quest.name: Into the Firestorm
journal: Urianger's knitted brow almost certainly spells trouble. Namely, for you.

Following a brief bout of contemplation and postulation, Urianger arrives at the conclusion that in order to complete the cycle of rainfall and evaporation in the Empty, the elements of wind and fire must be restored simultaneously. Naturally, this means that the burden on Ryne and yourself will in effect be doubled, as you attempt to draw forth and meld the two contrasting types of aether. Not to be deterred, you both accept the challenge, though as Thancred points out, the increased strain will require you to be well rested before embarking on your next voyage. Gaia, impatient as always, storms off, while Ryne ponders over what might be troubling her.
Despite your best efforts to engage Ryne in conversation, she is reluctant to respond. Perhaps all she needs is someone to /rally her spirits.

Ryne explains that she has been worried about Gaia's well-being since before she awakened from her long slumber. Having been raised in isolation, Ryne has precious little experience in speaking with people of a similar age, and she is unsure as to how to approach Gaia. Given what the pair have in common, it seems reasonable to expect that they would be well matched as friends, although Gaia's sullen demeanor makes even approaching her somewhat daunting. Thancred encourages Ryne to take the first step and initiate conversation, while the rest of you silently observe the exchange from just within earshot.

Ryne overcomes her initial anxiousness and engages Gaia in some light small talk. Unfortunately, this is met with a less-than-favorable response, with Gaia expressing her distaste for Ryne's positive outlook before turning on her heels and making her way to Eden's core. Taking this as a cue, Urianger suggests that now would be the opportune moment to commence the next phase of the plan.

Urianger has selected Ashfall as the next location, once known for its searing heat and relentless winds. You conjure the images of Ifrit and Garuda while Ryne calls forth the necessary aether to give form to your memories, although some doubt lingers over Ryne's ability to focus on the task at hand. Putting such fears to one side, all that remains is for you to vanquish two raging primals at the same time. What could be simpler?

※Eden's Verse: Furor can be accessed via the Duty Finder.

Having survived the combined assault of the reimagined deities of fire and wind, you return triumphant to Eden's core. Ryne is already preparing to pilot Eden back to the camp in order to properly assess the effect that your victory has had on the ambient aether of the Empty.

Torrential rain pours down on the vicinity of your camp, though you and your companions are content to stand in the open as it leaves you all drenched through. While Ryne is clearly delighted by the results, Gaia's mood darkens and she launches into a tirade aimed at Eden itself, before clutching her head and making nonsensical utterances. She eventually returns to her senses, but it seems that her inner turmoil has only temporarily subsided.
objectives: Speak with Urianger in Eden's core.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: As much as I bemoan Urianger's long-winded explanations, we'd be lost without him to take care of all the aetherial science and whatnot. Obviously, I'm quite sparing with my praise, as I wouldn't want it to go to his head.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I'm not sure what I was expecting to see after restoring the lightning element, but I did feel a little disheartened. Still, as Thancred and Urianger say, there are changes taking place, even if they're not immediately obvious.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: One plan fails to achieve the desired effect, so you move on to the next with minimal brooding and prattling. It seems we're finally learning.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Ere we set out once more, might I ask if thou art familiar with the process by which rain is made to fall?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I suppose so?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It's an Allagan conspiracy!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: We scholars tend to have a fairly solid grasp of it, yes.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Then thou shan't have difficulty understanding the explanation to come.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Hmm... It certainly would not be beyond the Allagans to manipulate the weather, if such is thy suggestion, but it is of naturally occurring phenomena that I would speak.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Ah, I spoke without regard for thy profession. I daresay thou art better versed in such matters than I. Might I impose on thee to divulge the intricacies to the less informed members of our party?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Then, with thy permission, I shall proceed.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: With the restoration of our first element, the Empty was once more blessed with the most essential ingredient in the cycle of precipitation: water.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Under normal circumstances, the heat existent in the atmosphere would cause water to evaporate from the land's surface.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: As invisible vapor, it is borne by the wind high unto the firmament, where it doth condense as clouds before descending once more, returning to the land in the form of rain.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: It seems we need wind-aspected aether to create more clouds. That it hasn't rained yet must mean there aren't enough.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: And even before that, we need fire-aspected aether to make the water evaporate.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: It seems to me that one's not much good without the other. Why don't you just draw out both elements together?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: You're suggesting that Forename fight two deiform entities, each one as deadly as Ramuh, at the same time? Do you realize how absurd that is?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: And yet...'tis a notion that doth warrant further consideration.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Oh, you can't be serious...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Cast your minds, if you will, to the elemental wheel I did show to you in the Bookman's Shelves.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Wind giveth rise to lightning, whose spark doth produce fire. By restoring both wind and fire in tandem, we may maintain balance between these dynamic elemental forces.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: The ensuing battle shall indubitably present an ordeal unlike any Forename hath ever faced. I believe, however, that this path doth lead to the prize we seek.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Oh, so perhaps it's not so absurd after all, eh, Thancred?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I wouldn't dream of questioning Urianger's grasp of the science behind it. My concern is for the burden this would place not only on Forename, but Ryne as well.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: What do you both make of the plan?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: If Urianger thinks it'll work, I'm willing to give it a try!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: As long as you know what you're letting yourselves in for. You're going to need all your strength, so see that you get plenty of rest.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Gaia!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I'd rather Ryne keep her mind on our work here than worry about Gaia. Mind you, it might be better for them to clear the air before we go any further.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I have selected a location in which wind- and fire-aspected aether lie dormant, though I shall wait until Ryne hath completed her preparations ere I dispense with the particulars.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: I can't stand all of this waiting around. Having grown up in Eulmore, I'm used to only living for the moment.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: We never had any reason to concern ourselves with “later,” “tomorrow,” “the future,” and so on. Those things simply didn't matter.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: But after Lord Vauthry disappeared and the night returned, everyone in Eulmore started thinking differently. I was only there for a short time with Thancred, and I couldn't believe how much it had changed.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: It was almost as though under Lord Vauthry's rule, time had stopped moving altogether, and when it ended, life went back to how it was supposed to have been. They realized they had their whole lives ahead of them, to make plans, and look forward to a new day.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: It feels like I'm the only one who can't move on, as if I'm still stuck in the past. What's worse, I can barely remember any of it. Even so, I can't stand the way they act as if the past never happened, choosing to forget it all.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: It seems Ryne is reluctant to air her concerns. Were you to rally her spirits, she may become more willing to talk.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Yes, you're right. There's no use in trying to pilot Eden while I've got other things on my mind.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: It's about Gaia, you see.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: The truth is, that apart from Alisaie and Alphinaud, I hardly know anyone my own age. I thought that I should make an effort to be nice to Gaia, but... Well, you've seen how she is around me.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I understand that she's got her own problems to deal with, but I thought that maybe I could help her in some way.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: It's not my place to intrude, and I should probably just leave her be until we've finished restoring the elements. After all, that's more important, isn't it?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Let me talk to Gaia while you concentrate on the task at hand.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: ...Is what I would've said, once upon a time.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: It seems to me that you're the one best qualified to take care of this little problem. I know she can be a bit prickly─to put it mildly─but if anyone can get through to her, it's you.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Although we've only known her for a short while, we're all she's got, and I think she realizes that. Just let her know she's not alone and she'll come around eventually.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: All right, I'll give it a try. Umm... Do you have any advice?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Thancred certainly has the gift of the gab. He'll know what to say.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Urianger can talk the hind legs off a behemoth. Why not ask him?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I'm afraid that since arriving in the First, I've had little time to mingle with any of the locals, and I haven't a clue what young women like Gaia would be interested in.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Ah, that's given me an idea! I'll start with some small talk and go from there!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Actually, since before she even woke up, I've been asking Lyna about what's popular in the Crystarium. I thought it might be nice to show Gaia around the place one day, you see...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Though I am proficient in many tongues, such as Fae, I cannot claim to be as well versed in the parlance of the younger generation. Their predilections and inclinations are a mystery I have yet to unravel.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I don't know much about it either...but I believe I have a plan!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Before she even woke up, I've been asking Lyna about what's popular in the Crystarium. I thought it might be nice to show Gaia around the place one day, you see...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: So that's what you were doing? I suppose it makes for a nice change of pace from all that studying.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: And I must commend thee on thy choice of confidant. The captain's powers of observation maketh her a veritable font of wisdom concerning the behavior of the Crystarium's citizenry.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Yes, and now it's time to put that knowledge to good use.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Don't let the fear of rejection hold you back. Persistence is the key.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Speaking from experience, by any chance?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Wh-Whatever do you mean!?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Lessons learned from days spent in pursuit of ladies fair, one might suspect.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Gah! You couldn't help yourself, could you!?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: It's all right, Thancred. Your secret's safe with me!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Ahem! May I remind you that the reason we're here is to create a better future for everyone in the First, which includes you and Gaia.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: While it might not be on the same scale as bringing life back to the Empty, if you're able to befriend her, that will be another way of contributing to a brighter tomorrow.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: So go on, she's waiting for you.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: All right. Wish me luck!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Ryne is ready to approach the decidedly unapproachable Gaia. You had best observe the conversation from within earshot.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Hmm... She looks like she's got a lot on her mind. Maybe now's not such a good time?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Ryne is ready to approach the decidedly unapproachable Gaia. You had best observe the conversation from within earshot.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: It's when Ryne and I face our problems together that it truly feels like we're family. Or at least, what I imagine it would be like. I suppose we both grew up without our birth parents to guide us, but I think we turned out rather well given the circumstances.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I wonder if this is the kind of bond that F'lhaminn shared with Minfilia...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Thancred may have taken on the role of Ryne's surrogate father, but I have of late become something of a mentor to her, though largely in instilling what knowledge I can of the aetherial sciences. A more attentive student thou shalt seldom find.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Instead of bothering me when I'm obviously not in the mood to talk, why don't you get back to work?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Umm...

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: What do you want?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Oh! Ah, nothing really. It can wait till later...

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: For all we know, there might not even be a “later.”

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: If you've got something to say, hurry up and spit it out.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Erm... Is everything all right? Not feeling strange from being around Eden or anything?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Is that what you came here to talk about?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Actually... I wanted to ask you...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: W-Would you like to go and have coffee biscuits with me?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: What!?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Coffee biscuits! They serve them at the Second Serving in the Crystarium. Everyone's talking about them, so I thought that maybe once we've finished our work here, you and I could go there together.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Let me get this straight. You came to talk to me about biscuits?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Yes! They're light and crispy and when you dip them in the coffee they go all nice and squidgy!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: The only reason you're even interested in that in the first place is because everyone else is doing it. Can't you think for yourself?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: I do what I want, when I want. After all, the world could end at any moment.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: That's not going to happen! Not if I've got anything to do with it!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Listen, Gaia. I understand what you're going through. Believe me, I do. But you mustn't lose hope! A new day will come. Then another, and another. Life's not so bad if you give it a chance, you'll see!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Shut up! You think you know me!? Even I don't know who I am!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Until I find the truth, I'll never be free.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Then we'll find it together!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I've seen enough pain, enough loss, and I don't want to see any more! And that includes you, Gaia!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Why do you care so much about other people? What have they ever done for you? I'm sure you haven't forgotten how we Eulmorans treated you, the precious Oracle of Light. Like a bird in a cage!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: And yet, you act as if none of that ever happened. So forgiving, so selfless.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: You and your family brought back the night sky, and you finally had the chance to lead a normal life. But instead, you're flying around in a giant sin eater, trying to turn a barren wasteland into some sort of paradise, and for what?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: I may not remember much of my past, but I'm fairly certain I've never heard of anything so ridiculous. Out of morbid curiosity, I'll see it through to the end, but if you think that makes us friends, you are very much mistaken.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Gaia!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I surmise that to keep Gaia waiting overlong would only agitate her further.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I think we've both rested for long enough. Let's get started, shall we?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: <sigh> I hope it all goes according to plan...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Ryne's looking a bit down in the doldrums, but you let me worry about that. We can't allow anything to interfere with whatever goes on in your mind when summoning those primals.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Not you as well? Look, I've had enough small talk to last me a lifetime, so don't even bother. I believe you have a job to do, yes? Then be quick about it.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: To defeat the deiform manifestations of both wind and fire shall require every last mote of thy strength. That thou hast triumphed over such beings in previous encounters should be at the forefront of thy mind as we commence the summoning.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Where are we going this time, Urianger?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: The place called Ashfall doth satisfy our requirements, I believe. The fables speak of travelers sweltering beneath the blazing heat of the midday sun, while after nightfall, slicing winds did tear at their cloaks.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Hmm... I see. Hopefully it won't be quite that bad when I draw out the elements.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Ryne, my dear. May I remind thee that to focus is not the same as to deny other thoughts. Whatsoever it is that troubleth thee, thou wouldst be better for acknowledging it.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Yes, you're right, of course... It's Gaia that I'm worried about.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: That is well. May thy concern for her lend thee yet more strength.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: It's time. I'll begin drawing out wind and fire in equal measure.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Forename, we'll only get one chance at this, so let's make it count!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Memories of Garuda and Ifrit rage through your mind...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: If we summon two primals at once, maybe they'll fight each other? That way, you'll only need to beat the one left standing. But I suppose it defeats the purpose of it if you don't take them both down at the same time.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: How long has it been since our encounter with Ifrit and his Amalj'aa followers?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: My studies indicate that no equivalent of Garuda's servants, the Ixal, are present here on the First. My hypothesis as to the reason why can perhaps wait till another time.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: I wonder what sort of hellish beasts you've conjured up this time?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Combining the contrasting powers of different primals... That seems an awful lot like the Ultima Weapon. In any case, I'm pleased to see that you were as successful here as you were at the Praetorium.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: That two such ferocious beings should meld into a single entity is frightful indeed. Further research must needs be performed to fully comprehend this unexpected phenomenon.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: For a moment, I thought Ryne had lost control of the aether. Luckily, we managed to avoid any major disasters, from what I can tell.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: That was incredible! I never imagined they would fuse together like that, but you took them down all the same.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I suppose the main thing is that we're now two elements closer to restoring the aether of the Empty. Let's go and see what difference it's made!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: It actually worked! Just like Urianger said it would!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Everything we could've hoped for.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Indeed, our endeavors have been repaid manifold.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I wonder what will happen when we restore ice?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Umm... Is something the matter?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: One more element, and then what?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: You'll have achieved the impossible, while I'll still be...nothing. No memory, no past, no family... Nothing.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: The world has moved on and left me behind. Anyone who ever knew me is either dead or gone.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: So, almighty Eden, you can mend this broken world, but you can't restore one girl's memories!?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Give me my life back, damn you!

dialogue.name: GAIAVOICE
dialogue.text: I still hunger...

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Ahhh!

dialogue.name: GAIAVOICE
dialogue.text: Extinguish the accursed Light... Awaken our true power...

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Enough riddles! Tell me who I am!

dialogue.name: GAIAVOICE
dialogue.text: You are...

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: I am...

dialogue.name: GAIAVOICE
dialogue.text: Gaia...

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: ...Gaia.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Gaia? What's wrong?

dialogue.name: GAIAVOICE
dialogue.text: Reclaim your memories... Fulfill your destiny!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: I don't understand!

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Gaia! Can you hear me!?

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Get away from me!

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: <pant> <pant>

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Amidst the sound of falling rain, your voice called from within.

dialogue.name: GAIA
dialogue.text: Long after the rain passed, your voice echoed on...
